intro: Diplanthera madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star lily, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows as an epiphytic or lithophytic plant, often found on trees or rocks in humid environments. The botanical features of this species make it a unique and visually appealing addition to botanical collections.
